question: True or false: If your feature is in the General Availability phase, then your feature will receive support from all Microsoft support channels.

explanations.FALSE: Incorrect. GA features are fully supported.
explanations.TRUE: Correct. General Availability means full support from Microsoft support channels.

question: TRUE OR FALSE: Azure Tenant is a dedicated and trusted instance of Microsoft Entra ID that's automatically created when your organization signs up for a Microsoft cloud service subscription.

explanations.TRUE: Correct. Azure Tenant is created automatically when subscribing to a Microsoft cloud service.
explanations.FALSE: Incorrect. The tenant is indeed created automatically and is a trusted instance of Entra ID.

question: Which of the following would be an example of an Internet of Things (IoT) device?
options: A web application that people use to perform their banking tasks
A video game, installed on Windows clients around the world, that keep user scores in the cloud.
A refrigerator that monitors how much milk you have left and sends you a text message when you are running low
A mobile application that is used to watch online video courses
correct: A refrigerator that monitors how much milk you have left and sends you a text message when you are running low

explanations.A web application that people use to per: Incorrect. Web apps are not IoT devices.
explanations.A video game, installed on Windows clien: Incorrect. Not a physical device connected to the Internet to send data.
explanations.A refrigerator that monitors how much mi: Correct. This is a classic example of an IoT device.
explanations.A mobile application that is used to wat: Incorrect. Mobile apps are not IoT devices.

question: What does the letter R in RBAC stand for?

explanations.Role: Correct. RBAC stands for Role-Based Access Control.
explanations.Review: Incorrect. Review is not what the R stands for.
explanations.Rights: Incorrect. Rights are granted based on roles.

question: What data format are ARM templates created in?

explanations.HTML: Incorrect. HTML is used for web layout, not infrastructure templates.
explanations.JSON: Correct. Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates are written in JSON.
explanations.YAML: Incorrect. YAML is used in some other cloud platforms like Kubernetes, but not for ARM templates.

question: How does Multi-Factor Authentication make a system more secure?
options: It is another password that a user has to memorize, making it more secure
It requires the user to have access to their verified phone in order to log in
It doesn't make it more secure
It allows the user to log in without a password because they have already previously been validated using a browser cookie
correct: It requires the user to have access to their verified phone in order to log in

explanations.It is another password that a user has t: Incorrect. MFA involves something you *have*, not just another password.
explanations.It requires the user to have access to t: Correct. MFA adds a second layer of authentication such as a phone.
explanations.It allows the user to log in without a p: Incorrect. That’s session management, not MFA.

question: What software is used to synchronize your on premises AD with your Azure AD?

explanations.Azure AD Federation Services: Incorrect. Used for federated identity but not synchronization.
explanations.AD Connect: Correct. Azure AD Connect is the tool used to sync on-prem AD to Azure AD.
explanations.Azure AD Domain Services: Incorrect. Provides domain join services but not sync.
explanations.LDAP: Incorrect. LDAP is a protocol, not the sync tool.

question: What is the service level agreement for two or more Azure Virtual Machines that have been manually placed into different Availability Zones in the same region?

explanations.99.90%: Too low for Availability Zone-based deployments.
explanations.99.99%: Correct. Using multiple Availability Zones gives this high SLA.
explanations.99.95%: Applies to availability sets or single VM with premium SSD.

question: Deploying Azure App Services applications consists of what two components? Pick two.

explanations.Configuration: Correct. Defines how the app runs.
explanations.Packaged code: Correct. The actual logic of the app.
explanations.Database scripts: Not a requirement for all apps.
explanations.Managing operating system updates: Handled by Azure — not part of your deployment.

question: Which two features does Virtual Machine Scale Sets provide as part of the core product? Pick two.
options: Automatic installation of supporting apps and deployment of custom code

explanations.Firewall: Incorrect. Not a built-in feature of VMSS.
explanations.Automatic installation of supporting app: Custom code deployment must be managed externally.
explanations.Load balancing between virtual machines: Correct. VMSS includes a built-in load balancer.

question: What is the service level agreement for two or more Azure Virtual Machines that have been placed into the same Availability Set in the same region?

explanations.99.90%: Too low for VMs in an availability set.
explanations.100%: Azure does not offer 100% uptime SLA.
explanations.99.99%: This SLA applies to VMs in Availability Zones.
explanations.99.95%: Correct. This SLA applies to VMs in the same Availability Set.

question: What are groups of subscriptions called?

explanations.ARM Groups: Not a valid Azure grouping feature.
explanations.Azure Policy: Used for governance, not grouping subscriptions.
explanations.Management Groups: Correct. They help organize and manage subscriptions.

question: What operating systems does an Azure Virtual Machine support?

explanations.Windows, Linux and macOS: macOS is not supported in Azure VMs.
explanations.Linux: Azure supports more than just Linux.
explanations.Windows and Linux: Correct. Azure supports these OSes in VMs.

question: Which style of computing is easiest when migrating an existing hosted application from your own data center into the cloud?

explanations.IaaS: Correct. IaaS supports 'lift and shift' migrations.

question: What are resource groups?
options: Based on the tag assigned to a resource by the deployment script, it is assigned to a group
Automatically assigned groups of resources that all have the same type (virtual machine, app service, etc)
Within Azure security model, users are organized into groups, and those groups are granted permissions to resources
A folder structure in Azure in which you organize resources like databases, virtual machines, virtual networks, or almost any resource
correct: A folder structure in Azure in which you organize resources like databases, virtual machines, virtual networks, or almost any resource

Incorrect. Tagging is separate from resource group assignment.
You assign resources to groups manually.
This describes Azure AD groups, not resource groups.
Correct. Resource groups help organize resources logically.

question: How do you stop your Azure account from incurring costs above a certain level without your knowledge?
options: Set up a billing alert to send you an email when it reaches a certain level
Switch to Azure Reserved Instances with Hybrid Benefit for VMs
Implement the Azure spending limit in the Account Center
Only use Azure Functions which have a significant free limit
correct: Implement the Azure spending limit in the Account Center

Alerts notify you but don’t stop charges.
This helps reduce cost, not limit it.
explanations.Implement the Azure spending limit in th: Correct. It stops charges once a threshold is hit.
Helpful but doesn't guarantee no charges.

question: Which of the following scenarios is best addressed by using Microsoft Entra ID?
options: Storing and analyzing large volumes of structured data.
Automating the deployment of virtual machines using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
Monitoring the performance of Azure resources in real-time.
Providing a centralized identity management solution for hybrid cloud environments.
correct: Providing a centralized identity management solution for hybrid cloud environments.

explanations.Storing and analyzing large volumes of s: Better suited for Azure Synapse or Cosmos DB.
Managed by ARM templates or Bicep.
explanations.Providing a centralized identity managem: Correct. Entra ID is designed for this.

question: What type of documents does the Microsoft Service Trust Portal provide?
options: Documentation on the individual Azure services and solutions
A list of standards that Microsoft follows, pen test results, security assessments, white papers
Guides for developing secure Azure applications
correct: A list of standards that Microsoft follows, pen test results, security assessments, white papers

explanations.Documentation on the individual Azure se: Available on Microsoft Learn, not the Trust Portal.
Correct. This is what the Trust Portal offers.

question: What is the primary purpose of Azure Sovereign Regions?
options: To provide free Azure services for educational institutions and non-profits.
To enable faster performance for global applications by reducing latency.
To offer Azure services that comply with specific government regulations and data residency requirements.
To provide lower-cost Azure services for small and medium-sized businesses.
correct: To offer Azure services that comply with specific government regulations and data residency requirements.

Not the purpose of Sovereign Regions.
They may help, but it's not the main goal.
Correct. Sovereign regions focus on compliance and residency.

question: What happens if Azure does not meet its own Service Level Agreement guarantee (SLA)?
options: You will be financially refunded a small amount of your monthly fee
It's not possible. Azure will always meet its SLA?
The service will be free that month
correct: You will be financially refunded a small amount of your monthly fee

explanations.You will be financially refunded a small: Correct. Microsoft refunds 10–25% depending on SLA breach.
explanations.The service will be free that month: Incorrect. Only partial credit is provided.

question: Which Azure management tool analyzes your usage of Azure and makes suggestions specifically targeted to help you optimize your usage of Azure regarding cost, security and performance?

explanations.Azure Firewall: Incorrect. It provides network security, not optimization suggestions.
explanations.Azure Service Health: Tracks service issues, not personalized recommendations.

question: Where can you go to see what standards Microsoft is in compliance with?

explanations.Azure Security Center: Focuses on threat protection and security management.

explanations.Trust Center: Correct. Lists all compliance certifications and standards.

question: Which database product offers 'sub 5 millisecond' response times as a feature?

explanations.SQL Server in a VM: Relational database not optimized for ultra-low latency.
explanations.Azure SQL Database: Optimized for transactional workloads, but not sub-5ms.
explanations.SQL Data Warehouse: Now Synapse — designed for analytics, not latency.

question: Why should you divide your application into multiple subnets as opposed to having all your web, application and database servers running on the same subnet?
options: There are only a limited number of IP addresses available per subnet, so you need multiple subnets over a certain number.
Each server type of your application requires its own subnet. It's not possible to mix web servers, database servers and application servers on the same subnet.

Separating your application into multiple subnets allows you to have different NSG security rules for each subnet, which can make it harder for a hacker to get from one compromised server onto another.
correct: Separating your application into multiple subnets allows you to have different NSG security rules for each subnet, which can make it harder for a hacker to get from one compromised server onto another.

explanations.There are only a limited number of IP ad: Not the main reason in this context.

question: Which Azure service can be enabled to enable Multi-Factor Authentication for administrators but not require it for regular users?

explanations.Advanced Threat Protection: Focuses on malware and threat detection.
explanations.Azure Firewall: Network-level security, not user access control.
explanations.Privileged Identity Management: Correct. Controls access for admins specifically.
explanations.Azure AD B2B: For external user collaboration, not role-based MFA enforcement.

question: What advantage does an Application Gateway have over a Load Balancer?
options: Application Gateway understands the HTTP protocol and can interpret the URL and make decisions based on the URL.
Application Gateway is more like an enterprise-grade product. You should not use a load balancer in production.
Application Gateway can be scaled so that two, three or more instances of the gateway can support your application.
correct: Application Gateway understands the HTTP protocol and can interpret the URL and make decisions based on the URL.

Correct. It can make routing decisions based on URL path.
True but not the key differentiator.

question: If you have an Azure free account, with a $200 credit for the first month, what happens when you reach the $200 limit?
options: Your credit card is automatically billed.
You cannot create any more resources until you add more credits to the account.
All services are stopped and you must decide whether you want to convert to a paid account or not.
correct: All services are stopped and you must decide whether you want to convert to a paid account or not.

True partially, but doesn't cover stopping services.
Correct. Resources are paused until upgrade.

question: What is the core problem that you need to solve in order to have a high-availability application?
options: You need to avoid single points of failure
You need to ensure the capacity of your server exceeds your highest number of expected concurrent users
You need to ensure your server has a lot of RAM and a lot of CPUs
You should have a backup copy of your application on standby, ready to be started up when the main application fails.
correct: You need to avoid single points of failure

Resources help, but do not solve failure scenarios.
Helpful, but not a full HA solution alone.

question: What is the name of the collective set of APIs that provide machine learning and artificial intelligence services to your own applications like voice recognition, image tagging, and chat bot?

explanations.Azure Machine Learning Studio: Used for training and deploying ML models.

question: What does it mean that security is a 'shared model' in Azure?
options: You must keep your security keys private and ensure it doesn't get out.
Azure takes care of security completely.
Azure takes no responsibility for security.
Both users and Azure have responsibilities for security.
correct: Both users and Azure have responsibilities for security.

explanations.You must keep your security keys private: True, but not a full definition of the model.
Incorrect. You are responsible for workloads.
explanations.Both users and Azure have responsibiliti: Correct. This defines the shared responsibility model.

question: Who is responsible for the security of the physical servers in an Azure data center?

question: What is Single Sign-On?

correct: The ability to use an existing user id and password to sign in other applications, and not have to create/memorize a new one.
